017package org.apache.juneau.cp;
018
019import static java.util.stream.Collectors.*;
020import static java.util.stream.Collectors.toList;
021import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
022import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.StringUtils.*;
023import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
024import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.map;
025
026import java.lang.annotation.*;
027import java.util.*;
028import java.util.concurrent.*;
029import java.util.function.*;
030import java.util.stream.*;
031
032import org.apache.juneau.*;
033import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
034import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
035import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
036import org.apache.juneau.marshaller.*;
037import org.apache.juneau.reflect.*;
038
039/**
040 * Java bean store.
041 *
042 * <p>
043 * A simple storage database for beans keyed by type and name.
044 * Used to retrieve and instantiate beans using an injection-like API.
045 * It's similar in concept to the injection framework of Spring but greatly simplified in function and not intended to implement a full-fledged injection framework.
046 *
047 * <p>
048 * Beans can be stored with or without names.  Named beans are typically resolved using
049 * the <ja>@Named</ja> or <ja>@Qualified</ja> annotations on constructor or method parameters.
050 *
051 * <p>
052 * Beans are added through the following methods:
053 * <ul class='javatreec'>
054 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #add(Class,Object) add(Class,Object)}
055 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #add(Class,Object,String) add(Class,Object,String)}
056 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #addBean(Class,Object) addBean(Class,Object)}
057 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #addBean(Class,Object,String) addBean(Class,Object,String)}
058 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #addSupplier(Class,Supplier) addSupplier(Class,Supplier)}
059 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #addSupplier(Class,Supplier,String) addSupplier(Class,Supplier,String)}
060 * </ul>
061 *
062 * <p>
063 * Beans are retrieved through the following methods:
064 * <ul class='javatreec'>
065 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #getBean(Class) getBean(Class)}
066 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #getBean(Class,String) getBean(Class,String)}
067 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #stream(Class) stream(Class)}
068 * </ul>
069 *
070 * <p>
071 * Beans are created through the following methods:
072 * <ul class='javatreec'>
073 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #createBean(Class) createBean(Class)}
074 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #createMethodFinder(Class) createMethodFinder(Class)}
075 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #createMethodFinder(Class,Class) createMethodFinder(Class,Class)}
076 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #createMethodFinder(Class,Object) createMethodFinder(Class,Object)}
077 * </ul>
078 *
079 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
080 *    <li class='note'>Bean stores can be nested using {@link Builder#parent(BeanStore)}.
081 *    <li class='note'>Bean stores can be made read-only using {@link Builder#readOnly()}.
082 *    <li class='note'>Bean stores can be made thread-safe using {@link Builder#threadSafe()}.
083 * </ul>
084 *
085 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
086 * </ul>
087 */
088public class BeanStore {
089
090   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
091   // Static
092   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
093
094   /**
095    * Non-existent bean store.
096    */
097   public static final class Void extends BeanStore {}
098
099   /**
100    * Static read-only reusable instance.
101    */
102   public static final BeanStore INSTANCE = create().readOnly().build();
103
104   /**
105    * Static creator.
106    *
107    * @return A new {@link Builder} object.
108    */
109   public static Builder create() {
110      return new Builder();
111   }
112
113   /**
114    * Static creator.
115    *
116    * @param parent Parent bean store.  Can be <jk>null</jk> if this is the root resource.
117    * @return A new {@link BeanStore} object.
118    */
119   public static BeanStore of(BeanStore parent) {
120      return create().parent(parent).build();
121   }
122
123   /**
124    * Static creator.
125    *
126    * @param parent Parent bean store.  Can be <jk>null</jk> if this is the root resource.
127    * @param outer The outer bean used when instantiating inner classes.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
128    * @return A new {@link BeanStore} object.
129    */
130   public static BeanStore of(BeanStore parent, Object outer) {
131      return create().parent(parent).outer(outer).build();
132   }
133
134   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
135   // Builder
136   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
137
138   /**
139    * Builder class.
140    */
141   @FluentSetters
142   public static class Builder {
143
144      BeanStore parent;
145      boolean readOnly, threadSafe;
146      Object outer;
147      Class<? extends BeanStore> type;
148      BeanStore impl;
149
150      /**
151       * Constructor.
152       */
153      protected Builder() {}
154
155      /**
156       * Instantiates this bean store.
157       *
158       * @return A new bean store.
159       */
160      public BeanStore build() {
161         if (impl != null)
162            return impl;
163         if (type == null || type == BeanStore.class)
164            return new BeanStore(this);
165
166         ClassInfo c = ClassInfo.of(type);
167
168         MethodInfo m = c.getDeclaredMethod(
169            x -> x.isPublic()
170            && x.hasNoParams()
171            && x.isStatic()
172            && x.hasName("getInstance")
173         );
174         if (m != null)
175            return m.invoke(null);
176
177         ConstructorInfo ci = c.getPublicConstructor(x -> x.canAccept(this));
178         if (ci != null)
179            return ci.invoke(this);
180
181         ci = c.getDeclaredConstructor(x -> x.isProtected() && x.canAccept(this));
182         if (ci != null)
183            return ci.accessible().invoke(this);
184
185         throw new BasicRuntimeException("Could not find a way to instantiate class {0}", type);
186      }
187
188      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
189      // Properties
190      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
191
192      /**
193       * Specifies the parent bean store.
194       *
195       * <p>
196       * Bean searches are performed recursively up this parent chain.
197       *
198       * @param value The setting value.
199       * @return  This object.
200       */
201      @FluentSetter
202      public Builder parent(BeanStore value) {
203         parent = value;
204         return this;
205      }
206
207      /**
208       * Specifies that the bean store is read-only.
209       *
210       * <p>
211       * This means methods such as {@link BeanStore#addBean(Class, Object)} cannot be used.
212       *
213       * @return  This object.
214       */
215      @FluentSetter
216      public Builder readOnly() {
217         readOnly = true;
218         return this;
219      }
220
221      /**
222       * Specifies that the bean store being created should be thread-safe.
223       *
224       * @return  This object.
225       */
226      @FluentSetter
227      public Builder threadSafe() {
228         threadSafe = true;
229         return this;
230      }
231
232      /**
233       * Specifies the outer bean context.
234       *
235       * <p>
236       * The outer context bean to use when calling constructors on inner classes.
237       *
238       * @param value The outer bean context.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
239       * @return  This object.
240       */
241      @FluentSetter
242      public Builder outer(Object value) {
243         this.outer = value;
244         return this;
245      }
246
247      /**
248       * Overrides the bean to return from the {@link #build()} method.
249       *
250       * @param value The bean to return from the {@link #build()} method.
251       * @return This object.
252       */
253      @FluentSetter
254      public Builder impl(BeanStore value) {
255         this.impl = value;
256         return this;
257      }
258
259      /**
260       * Overrides the bean store type.
261       *
262       * <p>
263       * The specified type must have one of the following:
264       * <ul>
265       *    <li>A static <c>getInstance()</c> method.
266       *    <li>A public constructor that takes in this builder.
267       *    <li>A protected constructor that takes in this builder.
268       * </ul>
269       *
270       * @param value The bean store type.
271       * @return This object.
272       */
273      @FluentSetter
274      public Builder type(Class<? extends BeanStore> value) {
275         this.type = value;
276         return this;
277      }
278   }
279
280   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
281   // Instance
282   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
283
284   private final Deque<BeanStoreEntry<?>> entries;
285   private final Map<Class<?>,BeanStoreEntry<?>> unnamedEntries;
286
287   final Optional<BeanStore> parent;
288   final Optional<Object> outer;
289   final boolean readOnly, threadSafe;
290   final SimpleReadWriteLock lock;
291
292   BeanStore() {
293      this(create());
294   }
295
296   /**
297    * Constructor.
298    *
299    * @param builder The builder containing the settings for this bean.
300    */
301   protected BeanStore(Builder builder) {
302      parent = Utils.opt(builder.parent);
303      outer = Utils.opt(builder.outer);
304      readOnly = builder.readOnly;
305      threadSafe = builder.threadSafe;
306      lock = threadSafe ? new SimpleReadWriteLock() : SimpleReadWriteLock.NO_OP;
307      entries = threadSafe ? new ConcurrentLinkedDeque<>() : new LinkedList<>();
308      unnamedEntries = threadSafe ? new ConcurrentHashMap<>() : map();
309   }
310
311   /**
312    * Adds an unnamed bean of the specified type to this factory.
313    *
314    * @param <T> The class to associate this bean with.
315    * @param beanType The class to associate this bean with.
316    * @param bean The bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
317    * @return This object.
318    */
319   public <T> BeanStore addBean(Class<T> beanType, T bean) {
320      return addBean(beanType, bean, null);
321   }
322
323   /**
324    * Adds a named bean of the specified type to this factory.
325    *
326    * @param <T> The class to associate this bean with.
327    * @param beanType The class to associate this bean with.
328    * @param bean The bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
329    * @param name The bean name if this is a named bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
330    * @return This object.
331    */
332   public <T> BeanStore addBean(Class<T> beanType, T bean, String name) {
333      return addSupplier(beanType, ()->bean, name);
334   }
335
336   /**
337    * Adds a supplier for an unnamed bean of the specified type to this factory.
338    *
339    * @param <T> The class to associate this bean with.
340    * @param beanType The class to associate this bean with.
341    * @param bean The bean supplier.
342    * @return This object.
343    */
344   public <T> BeanStore addSupplier(Class<T> beanType, Supplier<T> bean) {
345      return addSupplier(beanType, bean, null);
346   }
347
348   /**
349    * Adds a supplier for a named bean of the specified type to this factory.
350    *
351    * @param <T> The class to associate this bean with.
352    * @param beanType The class to associate this bean with.
353    * @param bean The bean supplier.
354    * @param name The bean name if this is a named bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
355    * @return This object.
356    */
357   public <T> BeanStore addSupplier(Class<T> beanType, Supplier<T> bean, String name) {
358      assertCanWrite();
359      BeanStoreEntry<T> e = createEntry(beanType, bean, name);
360      try (SimpleLock x = lock.write()) {
361         entries.addFirst(e);
362         if (Utils.isEmpty(name))
363            unnamedEntries.put(beanType, e);
364      }
365      return this;
366   }
367
368   /**
369    * Same as {@link #addBean(Class,Object)} but returns the bean instead of this object for fluent calls.
370    *
371    * @param <T> The class to associate this bean with.
372    * @param beanType The class to associate this bean with.
373    * @param bean The bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
374    * @return The bean.
375    */
376   public <T> T add(Class<T> beanType, T bean) {
377      add(beanType, bean, null);
378      return bean;
379   }
380
381   /**
382    * Same as {@link #addBean(Class,Object,String)} but returns the bean instead of this object for fluent calls.
383    *
384    * @param <T> The class to associate this bean with.
385    * @param beanType The class to associate this bean with.
386    * @param bean The bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
387    * @param name The bean name if this is a named bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
388    * @return The bean.
389    */
390   public <T> T add(Class<T> beanType, T bean, String name) {
391      addBean(beanType, bean, name);
392      return bean;
393   }
394
395   /**
396    * Clears out all bean in this bean store.
397    *
398    * <p>
399    * Does not affect the parent bean store.
400    *
401    * @return This object.
402    */
403   public BeanStore clear() {
404      assertCanWrite();
405      try (SimpleLock x = lock.write()) {
406         unnamedEntries.clear();
407         entries.clear();
408      }
409      return this;
410   }
411
412   /**
413    * Returns the unnamed bean of the specified type.
414    *
415    * @param <T> The type of bean to return.
416    * @param beanType The type of bean to return.
417    * @return The bean.
418    */
419   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
420   public <T> Optional<T> getBean(Class<T> beanType) {
421      try (SimpleLock x = lock.read()) {
422         BeanStoreEntry<T> e = (BeanStoreEntry<T>) unnamedEntries.get(beanType);
423         if (e != null)
424            return Utils.opt(e.get());
425         if (parent.isPresent())
426            return parent.get().getBean(beanType);
427         return Utils.opte();
428      }
429   }
430
431   /**
432    * Returns the named bean of the specified type.
433    *
434    * @param <T> The type of bean to return.
435    * @param beanType The type of bean to return.
436    * @param name The bean name.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
437    * @return The bean.
438    */
439   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
440   public <T> Optional<T> getBean(Class<T> beanType, String name)  {
441      try (SimpleLock x = lock.read()) {
442         BeanStoreEntry<T> e = (BeanStoreEntry<T>)entries.stream().filter(x2 -> x2.matches(beanType, name)).findFirst().orElse(null);
443         if (e != null)
444            return Utils.opt(e.get());
445         if (parent.isPresent())
446            return parent.get().getBean(beanType, name);
447         return Utils.opte();
448      }
449   }
450
451   /**
452    * Returns all the beans in this store of the specified type.
453    *
454    * <p>
455    * Returns both named and unnamed beans.
456    *
457    * <p>
458    * The results from the parent bean store are appended to the list of beans from this beans store.
459    *
460    * @param <T> The bean type to return.
461    * @param beanType The bean type to return.
462    * @return The bean entries.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
463    */
464   public <T> Stream<BeanStoreEntry<T>> stream(Class<T> beanType)  {
465      @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
466      Stream<BeanStoreEntry<T>> s = entries.stream().filter(x -> x.matches(beanType)).map(x -> (BeanStoreEntry<T>)x);
467      if (parent.isPresent())
468         s = Stream.concat(s, parent.get().stream(beanType));
469      return s;
470   }
471
472   /**
473    * Removes an unnamed bean from this store.
474    *
475    * @param beanType The bean type being removed.
476    * @return This object.
477    */
478   public BeanStore removeBean(Class<?> beanType) {
479      return removeBean(beanType, null);
480   }
481
482   /**
483    * Removes a named bean from this store.
484    *
485    * @param beanType The bean type being removed.
486    * @param name The bean name to remove.
487    * @return This object.
488    */
489   public BeanStore removeBean(Class<?> beanType, String name) {
490      assertCanWrite();
491      try (SimpleLock x = lock.write()) {
492         if (name == null)
493            unnamedEntries.remove(beanType);
494         entries.removeIf(y -> y.matches(beanType, name));
495      }
496      return this;
497   }
498
499   /**
500    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this store contains the specified unnamed bean type.
501    *
502    * @param beanType The bean type to check.
503    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this store contains the specified unnamed bean type.
504    */
505   public boolean hasBean(Class<?> beanType) {
506      return unnamedEntries.containsKey(beanType) || parent.map(x -> x.hasBean(beanType)).orElse(false);
507   }
508
509   /**
510    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this store contains the specified named bean type.
511    *
512    * @param beanType The bean type to check.
513    * @param name The bean name.
514    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this store contains the specified named bean type.
515    */
516   public boolean hasBean(Class<?> beanType, String name) {
517      return entries.stream().anyMatch(x -> x.matches(beanType, name)) || parent.map(x -> x.hasBean(beanType, name)).orElse(false);
518   }
519
520   /**
521    * Instantiates a bean creator.
522    *
523    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
524    *    <li class='jc'>{@link BeanCreator} for usage.
525    * </ul>
526    *
527    * @param <T> The bean type to create.
528    * @param beanType The bean type to create.
529    * @return A new bean creator.
530    */
531   public <T> BeanCreator<T> createBean(Class<T> beanType) {
532      return new BeanCreator<>(beanType, this);
533   }
534
535   /**
536    * Create a method finder for finding bean creation methods.
537    *
538    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
539    *    <li class='jc'>{@link BeanCreateMethodFinder} for usage.
540    * </ul>
541    *
542    * @param <T> The bean type to create.
543    * @param beanType The bean type to create.
544    * @param resource The class containing the bean creator method.
545    * @return The method finder.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
546    */
547   public <T> BeanCreateMethodFinder<T> createMethodFinder(Class<T> beanType, Object resource) {
548      return new BeanCreateMethodFinder<>(beanType, resource, this);
549   }
550
551   /**
552    * Create a method finder for finding bean creation methods.
553    *
554    * <p>
555    * Same as {@link #createMethodFinder(Class,Class)} but looks for only static methods on the specified resource class
556    * and not also instance methods within the context of a bean.
557    *
558    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
559    *    <li class='jc'>{@link BeanCreateMethodFinder} for usage.
560    * </ul>
561    *
562    * @param <T> The bean type to create.
563    * @param beanType The bean type to create.
564    * @param resourceClass The class containing the bean creator method.
565    * @return The method finder.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
566    */
567   public <T> BeanCreateMethodFinder<T> createMethodFinder(Class<T> beanType, Class<?> resourceClass) {
568      return new BeanCreateMethodFinder<>(beanType, resourceClass , this);
569   }
570
571   /**
572    * Create a method finder for finding bean creation methods.
573    *
574    * <p>
575    * Same as {@link #createMethodFinder(Class,Object)} but uses {@link Builder#outer(Object)} as the resource bean.
576    *
577    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
578    *    <li class='jc'>{@link BeanCreateMethodFinder} for usage.
579    * </ul>
580    *
581    * @param <T> The bean type to create.
582    * @param beanType The bean type to create.
583    * @return The method finder.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
584    */
585   public <T> BeanCreateMethodFinder<T> createMethodFinder(Class<T> beanType) {
586      return new BeanCreateMethodFinder<>(beanType, outer.orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalArgumentException("Method cannot be used without outer bean definition.")), this);
587   }
588
589   /**
590    * Given an executable, returns a list of types that are missing from this factory.
591    *
592    * @param executable The constructor or method to get the params for.
593    * @return A comma-delimited list of types that are missing from this factory, or <jk>null</jk> if none are missing.
594    */
595   public String getMissingParams(ExecutableInfo executable) {
596      List<ParamInfo> params = executable.getParams();
597      List<String> l = list();
598      loop: for (int i = 0; i < params.size(); i++) {
599         ParamInfo pi = params.get(i);
600         ClassInfo pt = pi.getParameterType();
601         if (i == 0 && outer.isPresent() && pt.isInstance(outer.get()))
602            continue loop;
603         if (pt.is(Optional.class) || pt.is(BeanStore.class))
604            continue loop;
605         String beanName = findBeanName(pi);
606         Class<?> ptc = pt.inner();
607         if (beanName == null && !hasBean(ptc))
608            l.add(pt.getSimpleName());
609         if (beanName != null && !hasBean(ptc, beanName))
610            l.add(pt.getSimpleName() + '@' + beanName);
611      }
612      return l.isEmpty() ? null : l.stream().sorted().collect(joining(","));
613   }
614
615   /**
616    * Given the list of param types, returns <jk>true</jk> if this factory has all the parameters for the specified executable.
617    *
618    * @param executable The constructor or method to get the params for.
619    * @return A comma-delimited list of types that are missing from this factory.
620    */
621   public boolean hasAllParams(ExecutableInfo executable) {
622      loop: for (int i = 0; i < executable.getParamCount(); i++) {
623         ParamInfo pi = executable.getParam(i);
624         ClassInfo pt = pi.getParameterType();
625         if (i == 0 && outer.isPresent() && pt.isInstance(outer.get()))
626            continue loop;
627         if (pt.is(Optional.class) || pt.is(BeanStore.class))
628            continue loop;
629         String beanName = findBeanName(pi);
630         Class<?> ptc = pt.inner();
631         if ((beanName == null && !hasBean(ptc)) || (beanName != null && !hasBean(ptc, beanName)))
632            return false;
633      }
634      return true;
635   }
636
637
638   /**
639    * Returns the corresponding beans in this factory for the specified param types.
640    *
641    * @param executable The constructor or method to get the params for.
642    * @return The corresponding beans in this factory for the specified param types.
643    */
644   public Object[] getParams(ExecutableInfo executable) {
645      Object[] o = new Object[executable.getParamCount()];
646      for (int i = 0; i < executable.getParamCount(); i++) {
647         ParamInfo pi = executable.getParam(i);
648         ClassInfo pt = pi.getParameterType();
649         if (i == 0 && outer.isPresent() && pt.isInstance(outer.get())) {
650            o[i] = outer.get();
651         } else if (pt.is(BeanStore.class)) {
652            o[i] = this;
653         } else {
654            String beanName = findBeanName(pi);
655            Class<?> ptc = pt.unwrap(Optional.class).inner();
656            Optional<?> o2 = beanName == null ? getBean(ptc) : getBean(ptc, beanName);
657            o[i] = pt.is(Optional.class) ? o2 : o2.orElse(null);
658         }
659      }
660      return o;
661   }
662
663   @Override /* Object */
664   public String toString() {
665      return Json5.of(properties());
666   }
667
668   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
669   // Extension methods
670   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
671
672   /**
673    * Creates an entry in this store for the specified bean.
674    *
675    * <p>
676    * Subclasses can override this method to create their own entry subtypes.
677    *
678    * @param <T> The class type to associate with the bean.
679    * @param type The class type to associate with the bean.
680    * @param bean The bean supplier.
681    * @param name Optional name to associate with the bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
682    * @return A new bean store entry.
683    */
684   protected <T> BeanStoreEntry<T> createEntry(Class<T> type, Supplier<T> bean, String name) {
685      return BeanStoreEntry.create(type, bean, name);
686   }
687
688   // <FluentSetters>
689
690      // </FluentSetters>
691
692   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
693   // Helper methods
694   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
695   private String findBeanName(ParamInfo pi) {
696      Annotation n = pi.getAnnotation(Annotation.class, x -> x.annotationType().getSimpleName().equals("Named"));
697      if (n != null)
698         return AnnotationInfo.of((ClassInfo)null, n).getValue(String.class, "value", NOT_EMPTY).orElse(null);
699      return null;
700   }
701
702   private void assertCanWrite() {
703      if (readOnly)
704         throw new IllegalStateException("Method cannot be used because BeanStore is read-only.");
705   }
706
707   private JsonMap properties() {
708      Predicate<Boolean> nf = Utils::isTrue;
709      return filteredMap()
710         .append("identity", Utils2.identity(this))
711         .append("entries", entries.stream().map(BeanStoreEntry::properties).collect(toList()))
712         .append("outer", Utils2.identity(outer.orElse(null)))
713         .append("parent", parent.map(BeanStore::properties).orElse(null))
714         .appendIf(nf, "readOnly", readOnly)
715         .appendIf(nf, "threadSafe", threadSafe)
716      ;
717   }
718}
